private_information: I am robot 1 responsible for executing a subset of the block moves.
I can pick up only the top block of a stack and carry one block at a time.
robot_1.goal: Execute the assigned moves legally under BlocksWorld rules and produce a concise verified action log.

private_information: I am robot 2 responsible for executing the complementary subset of block moves.
I follow standard BlocksWorld rules: only the top block can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
robot_2.goal: Execute the assigned moves legally under BlocksWorld rules and produce a concise verified action log.

private_information: I coordinate the two robots and produce the final PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the robots' logs, verify the move sequence, derive the final blocks arrangement, and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that encodes the final configuration as the goal.

public_information: This is a BlocksWorld domain with blocks labeled: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M.
Only the top block of any stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Initial arrangement: A is on top of M.
Initial arrangement: B is on top of E.
Initial arrangement: C is on top of J.
Initial arrangement: D is on top of F.
Initial arrangement: E is on top of L.
Initial arrangement: F is on top of H.
Initial arrangement: G is on top of K.
Initial arrangement: H is on the table.
Initial arrangement: I is on top of C.
Initial arrangement: J is on top of G.
Initial arrangement: K is on top of D.
Initial arrangement: L is on top of A.
Initial arrangement: M is on the table.
There are two robotic agents that jointly execute a given ordered list of 50 actions.

execute.system_prompt: You are a BlocksWorld execution agent. Your role is to verify and report on the legality and outcome of the moves you executed. Produce a concise action log describing each step and any illegal move detection. Do not emit PDDL.
execute.prompt: Your name is robot_1. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->robot_1->private_information} You executed the following actions in this order: unstack(I, C), unstack(C, J), pickup(C), unstack(B, E), unstack(C, I), unstack(E, L), unstack(E, L), unstack(E, B), pickup(I), pickup(I), unstack(I, E), unstack(E, L), pickup(B), unstack(B, E), unstack(B, I), unstack(I, C), unstack(C, J), unstack(B, E), unstack(C, I), unstack(E, L), unstack(C, B), unstack(L, A), pickup(B), unstack(L, C), unstack(B, A). Verify each action's legality under BlocksWorld rules and produce a concise verified action log describing the result and the local stack changes you observed. If any action is illegal, flag it and explain why.

execute.system_prompt: You are a BlocksWorld execution agent. Your role is to verify and report on the legality and outcome of the moves you executed. Produce a concise action log describing each step and any illegal move detection. Do not emit PDDL.
execute.prompt: Your name is robot_2. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->robot_2->private_information} You executed the following actions in this order: putdown(I), putdown(C), stack(C, I), putdown(B), stack(C, J), stack(E, L), stack(E, B), stack(E, L), putdown(I), stack(I, E), stack(I, C), stack(E, L), stack(B, E), stack(B, I), stack(B, E), putdown(I), stack(C, I), putdown(B), stack(C, B), putdown(E), stack(C, I), stack(L, C), stack(B, A), stack(L, J), stack(B, C). Verify each action's legality under BlocksWorld rules and produce a concise verified action log describing the result and the local stack changes you observed. If any action is illegal, flag it and explain why.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent BlocksWorld and in producing PDDL artifacts for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate logs from multiple agents, resolve ambiguities, validate the combined move sequence, derive the final arrangement of blocks, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes the final arrangement as the goal. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, keep their actions labeled or commented so the planner can reflect that only one robot acts at a time.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the public information: {environment->public_information} Use the logs from the agents: {log_robot_1} {log_robot_2} Integrate the agents' verified action logs, detect and resolve any discrepancies, compute the final position of every block A..M (state whether each block is on the table or on top of another block), and then produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file ready for FastDownwards that has the final arrangement as the goal. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct where relevant.
